intro: Benzoin sikkimense, commonly known as Himalayan benzoin, is a small evergreen tree native to the eastern Himalayas. It produces a fragrant, resinous substance called benzoin, which is used in incense and perfumes. The plant has leathery, elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. It typically grows at high altitudes, preferring cool and moist environments. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
